message_1:
Using frequency analysis, a cipher text has the following letter frequencies: 

A: 0.067, B: 0.024, C: 0.035, D: 0.039, E: 0.111, F: 0.021, G: 0.024, H: 0.071, I: 0.080, J: 0.002, K: 0.008, L: 0.042, M: 0.025, N: 0.081, O: 0.070, P: 0.021, Q: 0.002, R: 0.065, S: 0.070, T: 0.095, U: 0.030, V: 0.009, W: 0.021, X: 0.002, Y: 0.020, Z: 0.002.

What is the most likely substitution for each of the letters in this cipher?
message_2:
To find the most likely substitution for each letter in the cipher, we can compare the given letter frequencies to the standard English letter frequencies. The standard English letter frequencies are approximately as follows:

E: 0.1202, T: 0.0910, A: 0.0812, O: 0.0768, I: 0.0731, N: 0.0695, S: 0.0628, R: 0.0602, H: 0.0592, D: 0.0432, L: 0.0398, U: 0.0288, C: 0.0271, M: 0.0261, F: 0.0230, Y: 0.0211, W: 0.0209, G: 0.0203, P: 0.0182, B: 0.0149, V: 0.0111, K: 0.0069, X: 0.0017, J: 0.0010, Q: 0.0010, Z: 0.0007

Now, we can match the given frequencies to the standard frequencies to find the most likely substitution:
